data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A pleasant full flavored beer. Caramel-like, chocolate-like and coffee-like aromas and flavors are present.

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Have you ever wanted to shove a bunch of silk into a pint glass and drink it? No? That's weird, we have. Anyway, here's your chance to get close to it. This delicately hopped  and generously oated stout will have you begging for more, but it is a very limited release, so get some while you can.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Brewed with healthy doses of chocolate and black patent malts, this delightful beer is as black as the cold night sky but its robust flavor and smooth finish will warm you to the core. Try it with hard cider for a Snakebite.

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: This beer gets its dark color from the use of roasted barley, black malt, and chocolate malt used in the mash.  Oatmeal is also used in this recipe which produces a beer with an exceptionally smooth and silky texture.  The flavor is dominated by a dry roasted malt character with just enough hop bitterness to round out the flavor.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A full-bodied stout that gets its smoothness from the oat addition. The oats also give the stout a nice sweetness that makes this stout easy drinking.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Our Oatmeal Stout first hits your nose with an aromatic blend of raw oats, chocolate, and roasted malts. A black ruby hue and thick creamy off white head make this stout one you will never forget. Best served at 55ºF in a pub or pint glass.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Our full bodied sweet stout brewed with roasted and flaked barley and rolled oats. A very nice dark colored stout with a creamy sweet finish.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description:
Rich, round and roasted, our Oatmeal Stout is satisfaction in a glass. It's a bold, smooth-bodied concoction that oozes dark-roasted coffee aromas and flavors of espresso and semi-sweet chocolate. We round out these heady pleasures with a dose of flaked oatmeal for a creamy body and a semi-dry finish.

Unforgettable.

Yeast: Top Fermenting Ale Yeast
Malts: Two Row Pale, Caramel, Roasted Barley, Chocolate, Oat Flakes, Black
Hops: Chinook, Perle

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Rich, black in color, this beer has a mild, roasted grain aroma with hints of cocoa and coffee, and no discernible hop character. Oats lend a grainy softness to the texture, with rich malty flavors throughout, leading to a surprisingly dry finish without the burnt character of some stouts.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: The stout is traditionally a strong version of the porter, an older style. The stout is pitch black, with dark, roasted flavors with some chocolate thrown in. This is a rich beer which manages to maintain the characteristic oatmeal stout smoothness. The overall profile of this beer is of a rich, smooth stout, full of subtle undertones.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: ark, roasty and smooth. This beer is based on award-winning homebrewer Bob Kapusinski's winning entry in the Bluebonnet Pro-Am competition. Brewed with a substantial amount of roasted malts, flaked oats and brown sugar, this beer is sure to knock the chill off of even the coldest of winters.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: It’s a gigantic ale with two row, chocolate, Munich, special roast, black barley, black malt, roasted barley and crystal malts topped off with more than 100 pounds of oatmeal for a creamy smooth dark beer experience. Hopped just enough to balance the sweetness of the malt, we call this the breakfast beer of champions.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: There are some things in life that require a certain sense of bravado: these might include ordering a quadruple espresso, deciding to sleep without a nightlight, or choosing to live in a region of the continent that is gradually sinking into the Pacific Ocean. If you're no longer scared of the dark, then there's no reason to be afraid of our stout. A generous portion of rolled oats and lots of black roasted barley give this beer a warm, roasted nose, and a distinct dryness that succumbs to waves of lingering satisfaction.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A rich, full-bodied Stout with sweetness from caramel malt, bitterness from roasted barley and smoothness from flaked oats. Sure to satisfy even the heartiest stout lover. Available year-round on draft and in bottles.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Oats aren’t just for breakfast you know? Commonly referred to as a “meal in a glass,” our Oatmeal Stout is definitely the one meal of the day you should not miss. A rich, deeply malted extravaganza of a beer, Blue Point Brewing’s Oatmeal Stout is a dark beer drinker’s dream come true. We use pale, crystal, chocolate, and roasted malts with just the right amount of flaked oats added to produce an uncommonly silky brew. This full-flavored and rich tasting legendary dark beer is a romantically delicious microbrew to share with someone special, at anytime of the day or evening.
data.foodPairings: Smoked meat; general meat dishes; chocolate desserts; shellfish

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A smooth, full bodied very dark ale with assertive roasted malt and toffee aromas. It has a complex flavor profile that includes hints of coffee, roasted barley and chocolate. A slightly bitter beer, with a creamy finish that seems to linger in your mouth. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Munich Malt, Caramunich malt, Flaked Oats, Chocolate Malt and Roasted Barley. Hopped with Summit, Columbus, Simcoe and Cascade. Oatmeal Stout is a Seasonal and contains 6.2% ABV.

data.description: Brewed with 100 pounds of organic oats to provide a silky smooth mouthfeel. Opaque black with roasted coffee aroma followed by espresso and chocolate flavors. 5.1% abv.

This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Don't be afraid of the dark. Our Oatmeal Stout is a little shy but friendly, just like you. You two are gonna hit it off right away. Most beer is brewed entirely with barley but this one includes some oats, a closely-related cereal grain which adds a silky mouthfeel with creamy, long-lasting foam and lace. No harsh burnt notes here, we prefer bready, toasty and rich chocolate notes with a nice soft earthy note from fuggle hops. Full-bodied, warming, and smoooooooth.  Employees at the Civil Life have a long running joke with their doctors that tell them to eat oatmeal and they say, "What? Drink my oatmeal?"  Then they immediately end the appointment and return to "work".

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description:
Coffee and vanilla cola on the nose. Unsweetened cocoa and espresso on the palate give way to a light, lingering finish with notes of hop resin.

Sandi’s signature: Pale and specialty malt, oats, Cascade hops and our well water.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Our most recent addition to the lineup, this dark, full-bodied roasty ale finishes with a slight oatmeal note on the back end.  Oatmeal stout is sweeter than a dry stout, and the oats provide a slightly creamy mouth feel and complexity.  It has a slight roasted-grain flavor and aroma, which helps with the dry finish.  A subtle background fruity/earthy character from fermentation and hop notes round out the overall impression of this beer.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A traditional dry stout brewed for St. Patrick's Day, this deep black ale is served on Nitro to enhance it's smooth, malty character. Bready English malts and earthy Willamette hops come together to provide you with an excellent beer for your St. Patty's beer session.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: A robust English inspired silky smooth stout with notes of dark roasted coffee and chocolate

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: An old favorite at the Eccentric Café, Oatmeal Stout uses a hefty dose of flaked oats to lend a silky smooth texture, serving as a balance against the assertive coffee notes & roasted malt character.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: The notion that Stout was full of goodness encouraged the practice of prescribing Stout for medical purposes and this in turn brought about the trend of “Food Stouts”. The addition of 10% oatmeal gives this ale a distinctive smooth and silky mouth feel, and yes, it’s not just for breakfast anymore.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: No affectations, and certainly no gimmicks. Brewed truly to style, the aroma of bakers chocolate and fresh roasted coffee playfully waft from the glass. A rich blend of kilned malts give way to creamy caramel, subtle roastiness, and a hint of vanilla. The oats impart depth of character and a velveteen texture that rounds out all the flavors. Recommended pairings: Nutella filled crepes with shaved hazelnuts and a dusting of cocoa powder. Or as an appetizer, warm sourdough bread with Gruyer.
